page.title: 06Horton Common Redman's Hill
page.content: At Redman's Hill there are 6 barrows,4 of these are in a compact group,one of which has been excavated,in it were found a barrel urn,a casketfor burying dead peoples ashes.This barrow was of the"S.Lodge" type.This is some information about the 6 barrows:- 1.Bowl Barrow with well preserved ditch 9' across 2' deep total diam 57' height 6.5' 2.Bowl Barrow E.of Redman's Hill N. of Horton Common diameter 42' Ht.3' 3.Bowl Barrow diameter 30' Ht.3' 4.Bowl Barrow diameter 44' Ht.4' with remains of surronding ditch. 5.Bowl Barrow diameter 36' Ht.4' 6.Bowl Barrow diameter 46' Ht.4.5' The ground around these barrows has been very trampled by ancient trackways and hollow ways, the passage of many feet,cattle droves & carts.
